Class caesarCipher

  • java.lang.Object
    • caesarCipher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    cipherInterface

    public class caesarCipher
extends java.lang.Object
implements cipherInterface
    The caesarCipher Class represents the solution to the caesar cipher, the main cipher supported by the prototype.

    • Constructor Detail

      • caesarCipher

        public caesarCipher(java.lang.String cipherText)
        The constructor called in the cipherFactory class. It is used to set the initial variables, the cipher text and an array list of plainTextPerm objects. The array list is initialized as an empty list and will be added to when the program calls the decipher method.
        Parameters:
        cipherText - the cipher text of the cipher the program is deciphering.

    • Method Detail

      • decipher

        public void decipher(langConfig langConfig)
        this method is the implementation of the decipher method required by the cipherInterface. it handles the deciphering process for the caesar cipher. It first lets the user know that the cipher has been identified as a caesar cipher. then calls the proper methods to calculate fitness scores, sort the possible outcomes, and then creates a result object.
        Specified by:
        decipher in interface cipherInterface
        Parameters:
        langConfig - the language configuration used to access supported languages.

      • calcPerms

        private java.util.ArrayList<plainTextPerm> calcPerms()
        This private method is used to support the decipher method implementation used by the caesar cipher. It is responsible for performing the character shifts of the caesar cipher implementation. It does this by creating two Hash maps: a number to alphabet map, and a alphabet to number map. If the index of the letter in the alphabet + the current shift is too high, it will change the calculation to (index + shift) - 26 to represent the shift back to the beginning of the alphabet. as it finishes creating a permutation, it adds the new permutation to the list of permutations to return.
        Returns:
        An array list of plainTextPerm objects that represent each possible permutation of the cipher.

      • getCipherText

        public java.lang.String getCipherText()
        The get method used to access the cipher text variable and ensure proper encapsulation.
        Returns:
        the current cipher text.

      • getPossibleOutcomes

        public java.util.ArrayList<plainTextPerm> getPossibleOutcomes()
        the get method used to access the current list of possible outcomes and ensure proper encapsulation.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of plainTextPerm Objects representing the possible outcomes of the cipher.

      • setPossibleOutcomes

        public void setPossibleOutcomes(java.util.ArrayList<plainTextPerm> possibleOutcomes)
        the set method used to set a new list of possible outcomes and ensure proper encapsulation.
        Parameters:
        possibleOutcomes - the new list of possible outcomes.
